summary: Iahzit is a coastal Kobblin-led state on the Southia map, centered on the capital burg of Iahzit. River-laced (10 rivers) and spanning about 47,590 square units, it relies on four ports for sea access. Old Kobblin Shamanism predominates; minorities include Nortumbic and Wildlands cultures and non-religious folk. The army is cavalry-heavy with regiments named for Gneab and Dobok, backed by a small 1st Fleet. Major towns include Gigbig, Threshai (port), Sleh, Phiggal, and the capital Iahzit (port).
history: Formation as a Kobblin-led coastal polity during the Westford Era, consolidating around rivers and the burg of Iahzit.
Maritime development brings the total to four ports; Threshai and Iahzit emerge as principal seagates.
Regiments raised and named for Gneab and Dobok, establishing a cavalry-forward military tradition.
Urban growth sees Gigbig become the largest burg, with Sleh and Phiggal following.
Religious landscape stabilizes: Old Kobblin Shamanism remains dominant with small Nortumbic Spirits and unaffiliated minorities.
By 1291 W.E., Iahzit fields three cavalry-heavy regiments and a 1st Fleet while bordering four neighboring states.
geographyNotes: Coastal state with 10 rivers enabling inland-waterway movement and settlement clustering along banks and mouths. Dominant biomes: biome#1 (most prevalent), biome#3, and biome#5. The coastline supports four ports; interior routes largely follow river valleys. Borders four other states.
societyNotes: Demographically Kobblin-dominant with Old Kobblin Shamanism the principal faith. Minor presences of Wildlands and Nortumbic cultures, with adherents of Nortumbic Spirits and some with no religion. Social rhythm follows shamanic observances; minorities tend to concentrate in trade-facing quarters of port towns.
economyNotes: Sea and river trade define the economy via four ports; the main seagates are Threshai and the capital Iahzit. Top burgs by size: Gigbig, Threshai (port), Sleh, Phiggal, Iahzit (port). With no listed overland route hubs, commerce favors coastal and riverine corridors. The navy’s 1st Fleet protects maritime lanes.

factions.name: 1st (Gneab) Regiment
factions.motive: Defend Iahzit’s core lands and key crossings; act as rapid-response cavalry.

factions.name: 2nd (Dobok) Regiment
factions.motive: Patrol and secure the Dobok approaches; support coastal-port security when needed.

factions.name: 3rd (Dobok) Regiment
factions.motive: Reinforce Dobok sector and serve as mobile reserve for the south coast.

factions.name: 1st Fleet
factions.motive: Safeguard the coastline and the four ports; interdict threats along river mouths.

factions.name: Old Kobblin Shaman Circles
factions.motive: Preserve and guide the dominant Old Kobblin Shamanism rites and communal order.
factions.strength: Largest religious authority, aligned with the Kobblin majority.

factions.name: Threshai–Iahzit Port Syndicate
factions.motive: Keep harbor dues stable and shipping predictable across the main seagates.
factions.strength: Controls berths and logistics at two principal ports; strong merchant backing.

adventureHooks.title: Riders Gone Missing in Dobok
adventureHooks.setup: Scouts from the 2nd (Dobok) Regiment vanish along a river patrol near the Dobok approaches.
adventureHooks.escalation: Evidence points to interference moving between river landings and the coast, evading cavalry pursuit.
adventureHooks.reward: Regimental favor and escorted passage rights along Dobok patrol routes.

adventureHooks.title: Wharf Dues Dispute at Threshai
adventureHooks.setup: Dockworkers and merchants clash over new fees at Threshai’s port, threatening shipping schedules.
adventureHooks.escalation: Strikes ripple to Iahzit’s harbor; the 1st Fleet prepares to enforce order if talks fail.
adventureHooks.reward: Fee waivers for a season and priority berths at Threshai and Iahzit.

adventureHooks.title: Spirits of the Crossing
adventureHooks.setup: Nortumbic Spirits adherents request mediation with local shamans at a busy river crossing.
adventureHooks.escalation: A misunderstanding risks wider unrest among mixed-cultural wards in nearby towns.
adventureHooks.reward: Blessings from both clergy and safe-conduct papers for river towns.

adventureHooks.title: The Silent Harbor
adventureHooks.setup: One of the lesser ports stops signaling incoming convoys, spooking coastal traders.
adventureHooks.escalation: Navigational markers are found moved or missing near a river mouth, stalling traffic.
adventureHooks.reward: Salvage rights on recovered goods and commendation from the 1st Fleet.

adventureHooks.title: Counting the Ten
adventureHooks.setup: Iahzit commissions a survey of all ten rivers to improve movement and levy accuracy.
adventureHooks.escalation: Survey teams encounter competing claims from a neighboring state along an upriver reach.
adventureHooks.reward: A chartered trade license for river markets and an escort from the 1st (Gneab) Regiment.
